summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate observation check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 8, 2019. The sheets record staff checks on inmates in locked-down status, with signatures for each time slot, reviewed by lieutenants and a captain. This is a standard prison operations log.

events.title: Daily Inmate Observation Checks
events.description: Staff at MCC New York Special Housing Unit conducted mandatory 30-minute observation checks on all inmates in continuous locked-down status (administrative detention or disciplinary segregation) throughout the day and night.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York.
The logs are dated August 8, 2019, and cover multiple tiers (ZA Tier-G, H, J, K, M-Tier, L-Tier, ZB).
The purpose is to document that staff observed inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour, on an irregular schedule.
The sheets contain columns for time frames, start/end times, and staff signatures, but no specific inmate or staff names are legibly recorded.
Each sheet was reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, indicating a chain of custody for the log.
